title: Experimental Optimization and Machine Learning Modeling for Sanitizing Fresh-Cut Leafy Vegetables

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education involving team projects utilizing actual experimental equipment and digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can design an optimized sterilization condition experiment for fresh vegetables using the Taguchi Design of Experiments (DOE) method.
Learners can build and predict machine learning (e.g., GPR) models based on chemical oxygen demand (COD) and microbial removal rate data.
Learners can interpret machine learning model results to propose optimal sterilization conditions (cut size, agitation speed, chlorine concentration).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
